fields.title: Using Fabric to Deploy a Pinax Project
How To Do Something In Pinax
fields.content_html:
This is a fake how-to article about Pinax, just so there's content to use in the development of the new website.

Heading

That was a heading.

This is a list:

  • item
  • item
  • item

And what would a how-to-article be without code: 

@classmethod
def latest_development(cls):
    stable = cls.latest_stable()
    dev = cls._default_manager.filter(stable=False)[0]
    if V(dev.version) > V(stable.version):
        return dev
    else:
        return None
fields.teaser_html: I don't yet have time to write a real how-to article so this is just here for testing.

fields.title: New Website
fields.content_html:
The previous site had pretty much remain unchanged for a year other than the occasional addition of a new quote or new example site. In the lead up to PyCon and the first 0.9 alpha, we decided it needed a refresh.

As well as a new look and various tweaking of the copy, we've added events and a blog.

Blog posts will fall into three categories:

  • announcements
  • how-to-articles
  • community links

We hope that the new site will do a better job of letting you know what Pinax is about, how to use it and what is going on in the community.
fields.teaser_html: The Pinax project has a newly designed website.
